intro: Danaa yegua, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and are often used in ornamental gardening. Danaa yegua thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
